cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 275 miles SW of Port–au–Prince, Haiti
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north, forecast to turn NNW/NW after crossing Haiti–Cuba and track through the Bahamas toward the southeast U.S. coastline late this week.

weather_observation.watch_coast: Current watches confined to Jamaica, eastern Cuba, Turks & Caicos, and Bahamas – none for U.S. coast yet.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Current warnings confined to Jamaica, Haiti, eastern Cuba, and the southeastern Bahamas – none for U.S. coast yet.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Potentially from South Florida northward through Georgia and the Carolinas later this week.
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (≥34 kt) have a 16 % cumulative chance of reaching the port late Friday into Saturday; 50 kt winds remain an unlikely but non-zero (4 %) possibility.
weather_observation.storm_surge: If Matthew parallels the coast, on-shore flow could push water levels above 3 ft in tidal marshes and along the river entrance, especially during high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain associated with the cyclone’s outer circulation could drop 4 in or more, producing localized flooding Friday–Saturday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents will begin several days in advance; possible navigation restrictions on the Savannah River due to swell and elevated water levels.
